description: Borrowed from Spanish aficionado, past participle of aficionar (“to inspire affection”). Doublet of affectionate.

nouns.description: aficionado (plural aficionados or aficionadoes or (rare, hypercorrect) aficionadi)

entries.meaning: A person who likes, knows about, and appreciates a particular interest or activity (originally bullfighting); a fan or devotee. [from 19th c.]
examples: Synonyms: admirer, buff, connoisseur, enthusiast, expert, fan, follower, lover; see also Thesaurus:fan
